item.title: Campus Card Office Returning to the Student Union
item.description: We’re excited to share that the Campus Card Office is coming back to the heart of campus! After several years at 2144 Burdett Ave., we’ll be relocating to the Student Union starting January 12, 2026, making it even easier for you to connect with us where campus life happens.

item.title: Spring 2026 Parking Permits On Sale Now
item.description: Spring 2026 parking permits are now available! To sign up visit rpi.aimsparking.com. If you have any questions or need help, feel free to reach out to the Parking Office at 518-276-6616 or parking@rpi.edu - we’re happy to assist!

item.title: Webex Event Training Webinar on Friday January 16, 2026
item.description: Hosting a campus event or supporting a student webinar? Join a hands-on Webex Event Training Webinar, part of the MMS Collaboration Software Training series. Register now for this webinar presented via Webex on Friday January 16 from 11am-12pm: https://rensselaer.webex.com/webappng/sites/rensselaer/webinar/webinarSeries/register/783d951c6ab8482e9198a7bd6075a700 Learn the basics of Webex Event hosting, with demonstration and Q&A, along with new features recently added to the hosting platform.
item.author: Community

item.title: Division of Human Resources Professional Development Seminar – “Certifications & Skill Development in Percipio”
item.description: “Certifications & Skill Development in Percipio” This course introduces the tools available in Percipio to support growth through certifications and skill benchmarks. You’ll learn how to identify relevant certifications and use benchmark assessments to measure current knowledge. Perfect for employees and supervisors alike, this session will help you navigate the platform’s upskilling features and align learning with career development objectives.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Apply Now to RPI’s Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program!
item.description: The Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program (CSTEP) is excited to announce that applications for the Spring semester are now open! CSTEP is an academic enrichment program designed to support New York State residents who are economically disadvantaged and pursuing careers in STEM or health-related fields. Don’t miss this chance to elevate your academic and professional journey-apply today by visiting here and reach out to InclusiveExcellence@rpi.edu with any questions!
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Understanding Today’s Students: Practical tools to support learning, engagement, and well-being
item.description:
The Mainstreaming Mental Wellbeing Taskforce, in collaboration with the Provost’s office and the Division of Human Resources, has developed a two workshop training series to provide RPI faculty and staff with practical tools for understanding today’s students and responding to their evolving needs. Registration for Spring 2026 sessions is open. Lunch is provided!

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
